page.title: 18RISELEY OVER SIXTY CLUB
page.content: The club is simple,unpretentious, and open to all members of the village who have reached the qualifying age! Its aim is to provide a monthly get together with some form of entertainment. Typical recent examples have been a talk on antique musical boxes,a visit by a singing group of school masters from Bedford School,and a Derby Day Special,at which other staid members of the committee acted as bookmakers and tic-tac men. There is an annual summer coach outing,and a Christmas Party. Volunteer helpers supply tea,and the club raises money by bring and buy sales and a store at the village bazaar selling a wide range of items made by members.A mixture of self-help and local support,including generous help from the five bells darts players enables club to stay finacially able.
